Package com.luigisgro.cqf.curve

Interest rate curves and curve time-series data types for HJM processing

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
CurveTimeSeriesOperator<T extends TimePoint> An abstract operator extracting a scalar from a curve time series
TimePoint Point in time used to tag curves.
 

Class Summary
Curve Represents a curve of values distributed on a TermStructure for example a curve of interest rates
CurveApproximatingPolynomial A hybrid object with Curve nature, that can be used as a continuous scalar Function.
CurveTimeSeries<T extends TimePoint> An ordered set of Curve objects with the same TermStructure each associated to a TimePoint.
DayTimePoint Day implementation of TimePoint class
TermStructure A set of maturities (tenors) that define a family of curves
 

Package com.luigisgro.cqf.curve Description

Interest rate curves and curve time-series data types for HJM processing

Both historical curves and Monte Carlo simulations are stored in CurveTimeSeries objects. By implementing CurveTimeSeriesOperator, all the derivatives can generate cash flows processing the specific CurveTimeSeries, and therefore they can be evaluated with Monte Carlo methods.
